required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Observational Study On Metabolic Syndrome Parameters In Schizophrenia Patients Treated With Atypical Antipsychotics
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Non-Interventional, Observational Study On Metabolic Syndrome Parameters In Schizophrenia Patients Treated With Atypical Antipsychotics

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to find and follow-up the metabolic syndrome parameters on patients administering atypical antipsychotics.

detailed_description.textblock: Sampling Method Details: Group of patients using the same atypical anti-psychotic.

primary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter Body Mass Index (BMI)
primary_outcome.description: Iterative mean Body Mass Index at time points.
Iterative measurement of body weight. Mean at time points.
Iterative measurement of waist circumference. Mean at timepoints.

primary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter Fasting Blood Sugar
primary_outcome.description: Iterative measurement of fasting blood sugar. Mean at time points.
Iterative measurement of total cholesterol. Mean at time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL)
primary_outcome.description: Iterative measurement of LDL. Mean at time points

primary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter High Density Lipoprotein (HDL)
primary_outcome.description: Iterative measurement of HDL. Mean at time points
Iterative measurement of triglycerides. Mean at time points

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter BMI by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Iterative measurement of BMI. Mean at time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter Weight by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Iterative measurement of weight. Mean at time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter Waist Circumference by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Iterative measurement of waist circumference. Mean at time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter Triglycerides by Treatment Group
secondary_outcome.description: Iterative measurement of triglycerides. Mean at time points.

arm_group.description: Patients with schizophrenia who are currently receiving or are going to start a new treatment with atypical antipsychotics, ziprasidone, risperidone, quetiapine, olanzapine, aripiprazole, amisulpride.

biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood (fasting blood glucose, total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, HDL cholesterol, triglyceride levels)

study_pop.textblock: Female and male patients diagnosed as schizophrenia by DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, Fourth Edition) criteria; Age between 18-45 years; Patients who started atypical antipsychotic drug treatment or patients who switched from the previous conventional or atypical antipsychotic treatment to another atypical antipsychotic drug treatment by the decision of their physicians in psychiatry clinics in state and university hospitals.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female and male patients diagnosed as schizophrenia by the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders.
- Age between 18-45 years
- Patients who started atypical antipsychotic drug treatment or patients who switched from the previous conventional or atypical antipsychotic treatment to another atypical antipsychotic drug treatment by the decision of their physicians.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are pregnant or considering pregnancy.
- Patients who were included in a similar study

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects diagnosed with schizophrenia who have been using or recommended to use atypical antipsychotic drugs.

group.title: Atypical Antipsychotic Treatment
group.description: Subjects with schizophrenia treated with the atypical antipsychotic drugs ziprasidone, risperidone, quetiapine, olanzapine, aripiprazole, or amisulpride. The requirements of the study did not include inducement for any specific atypical antipsychotic drug. The most appropriate treatment for each subject was decided freely by their doctors.

participants_list.participants: Number of patients who remained on same medication to end of study.

outcome.description: Iterative mean Body Mass Index at time points.
outcome.population: Population : Full Analysis Set. Number of participants analyzed includes subjects with data for each visit.

group.title: Atypical Antipsychotic Treatment
group.description: Subjects with schizophrenia treated with the atypical antipsychotic drugs ziprasidone, risperidone, quetiapine, olanzapine, aripiprazole, or amisulpride. measure.title: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Iterative mean Body Mass Index at time points.
measure.population: Population : Full Analysis Set. Number of participants analyzed includes subjects with data for each visit.

analysis.groups_desc: We hypothesize that atypical antipsychotic therapy effects the metabolic syndrome parameters, particularly body mass index.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value was not adjusted for multiple comparisons; p-values < 0.05 were considered statistically significant.

outcome.title: Metabolic Syndrome Parameter BMI by Treatment Group
outcome.description: Iterative measurement of BMI. Mean at time points.
outcome.population: Population : Full Analysis Set. Number of participants analyzed includes subjects with data for each visit.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
